_Digitization.description: The process of converting a source from the physical world to the digital domain.

_Media.description: A digital file that encodes content according to a set of standards and can be decoded to display the content.

_Decomposition.description: Methods for splitting media across various dimensions.

_Decomposition_Audio Decomposition.description: Methods for splitting audio across temporal or spectral dimensions.

_Decomposition_Audio Decomposition_Spect.description: Methods for splitting audio in the spectral dimension.

_Decomposition_Audio Decomposition_Tempo.description: Methods for splitting audio in the temporal dimension.

_Decomposition_Image Decomposition.description: Methods for splitting images in the spatial dimension.

_Decomposition_Image Decomposition_Spati.description: Methods for splitting images in the spatial dimension.

_Decomposition_Video Decomposition.description: Methods for splitting video across the spatial and temporal dimensions.

_Decomposition_Video Decomposition_Tempo.description: Methods for splitting video in the temporal dimension.

_Decomposition_Video Decomposition_Spati.description: Methods for splitting video in the spatial dimension.

_Feature Extraction.description: Methods for extracting information about the content of media.

_Feature Extraction_Audio Feature Extrac.description: Methods for extracting information about audio.

_Feature Extraction_Image Feature Extrac.description: Methods for extracting information about images.

_Storage.description: Ways that digital content can be stored.
